data.title: Mike Miller to the Heat 5yr/$30 mil
data.meta_description: Specializing in drafts with top players on the NBA horizon, player profiles, scouting reports, rankings and prospective international recruits.
data.text:
I just saw that according mike miller’s dad that he is going to the heat for a 5 year $30 million deal. I think if they can get someone like brad miller to take the minimum then that would be a solid starting 5:

PG – Chalmers

SG – Wade

SF – James

PF – Bosh

C – B. Miller

Mike miller coming off the bench to play the 2 or 3 and moving wade or James to the point and let chambers rest.

Also pick up someone like Jason Williams to back up the point

A good pick up, but how can they give him that much money? They don’t have an MLE. It really depends on if they can work out another sign and trade.

Looking at another post, there are some decent bigs on the market that could help fill out the team, as well as a few pg’s.

possibilities:

Jason Williams (PG)

Etan Thomas (C)

Udonis Haslem (PF)

Mark Blount (PF/C)

Rafer Alston (PG)

Anthony Johnson (PG)

Most of these players would sign minimum deals for a chance to win a ring. I don’t think Haslem has to, because Miami owns his “Bird Rights”.

Still they could use one “Combo guard” as a back up or Sixthman since they just traded Beasley away for nothing.

I’m an ATL fan, so I would be ok with trading our 1st round pick (Jordan Crawford) for say Pittman and a future 1st. We could use the depth at C. And the salaries could be close with a late first and an early second.
